text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.70.1, TE/GE Examinations, Affordable Care Act (ACA) Hospital Compliance Review.
Removed IRM 4.70.1.2.4 (3), ACA Manager(s) Case Assignment, as the paragraph incorrectly paraphrased the National Agreement Article 16 Section 2 limitation on higher graded duties.

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This supersedes IRM 4.70.1 dated October 5, 2018.
AUDIENCE
Program Scope and Objectives
and (
) This IRM contains Exempt Organizations (EO) procedures for Affordable Care Act (ACA)
(r) Hospital Compliance Reviews. (

) It sets up guidelines for the ACA Hospital Review Group when performing pliance reviews of tax-exempt organizations operating a licensed facility to if they are following the requirements in Section
(r) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC) and IRC Section
) as illustrated by rulings such as Rev. Rul.
C.B.
) The ACA Hospital Review group is the intended audience for these procedures/instructions. (
) Section
) provides that hospital organizations must satisfy certain addi- tional requirements to be described under section
). A “hospital organization” is an organization that operates a facility which is required by State to be licensed, registered, or similarly recognized as a hospital. (
) Section

(r) imposes four main statutory requirements. A hospital organiza- tion must: a. At least once every three years, conduct a Community Health Needs sessment (CHNA) and adopt an implementation strategy to meet the health needs identiﬁed in the CHNA, b. Establish a written Financial Assistance Policy (FAP) and an emergency medical care policy, c. Limit charges for emergency and other medically necessary care provided to individuals eligible for FAP assistance, and d. Abstain from engaging in extraordinary collection actions until the organi- zation has made reasonable efforts to determine whether an individual eligible for FAP assistance. (
) The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (ACA), Public Law
, added IRC
) Public Law
, Section

(c), Review of Tax Exemption for Hospitals states “The Secretary of the Treasury or the Secretary’s delegate shall review at least once every three years the community beneﬁt activities of each hospital organization to which section
(r) of the Internal Revenue Code added by this section) applies.” (
) ACA Hospital Review cases are controlled, monitored, worked, and stored in the Reporting Compliance Case Management System (RCCMS). (
) The activity screens are viewable based on the role or permissions assigned within RCCMS. (

) Each level of the process completes the appropriate tabs: • Revenue agents (RA) complete the Organization , RA Conclusion , Facilities/Surveys tabs. • Revenue Agents in Charge (RAIC) complete the RAIC Review (
of and RAIC Review (
of
) tabs. • Manager completes the Triage tab. Care Act (ACA) Hospital Compliance

• Part V Sec A Complete • Part V Sec B Included • State Filings Reviewed • Part of Group Return Additional input may be required based on the selections, such as: • Group Return TIN • State/Local Filing Documents Reviewed • Government Entity or Indian Tribal Source The required ﬁelds will highlight in red when you select Validate for On the RA Conclusion tab, the RA will complete the following ﬁelds: • Issues Identiﬁed • Issues Identiﬁed Explanation • RA Predominant Issues Identiﬁed • RA Select Predominant Issues • Changes to Org Structure • RA Recommended Disposal Code • Final Conclusion Additional ﬁelds that may be required are: • Non-ACA Compliance Check • Non-ACA Examination • ACA Examination • RA Other Predominant Issues Explained • Valid EIN • Org Structure Explanation On the Closing tab, the RA will complete: • Sources • Hours per Case . In the grid, select role, name and input the hours spent on the case. Additional ﬁelds that may be required are: • Other Sources • IRC

Note: Facilities will be created based on the information obtained from the Form 990, Schedule H. Every facility record must be reviewed and updated with the required information.
) The New Facility button allows the addition of Facilities Sub-records identiﬁed during the review process but not included in the Schedule H.
) Agent Facility Sub-record (
) On the Facility Sub-record, the RA will verify or complete applicable ﬁelds, update any if necessary, and indicate if the facility should be included in the survey. (
) The RA must complete the following ﬁelds: • Include in Survey • Valid State License These ﬁelds allow the system to know whether to include the facility in the survey. (

) Once the Facility Sub-record is updated, it must be included in the survey. Note: Even though it may appear that you can create a survey (i.e., the button is available), the RA cannot create and save the survey unless he/she selects Validate for Update to indicate that the organization is a
), subject to
(r), and has a facility to survey; otherwise, an error will occur, and RA cannot ﬁnalize the survey.
) Agent Surveys (
) After completing the activity screens, the RA will then complete the surveys. (

) The surveys are on the same tab as the Facility Sub-records. Two buttons positioned at the bottom of the screen to create the surveys. The questions set up in sections which apply to each of the issues. (
) The RA must select the button for the survey that he/she is completing. (

) The RA will answer the survey questions, either by selecting an option from the drop-down box corresponding to each question, by selecting the appropri- ate check box, or by entering a response when a given question calls for one.

) Hospitals (
) Dual Status entities are governmental hospital organizations that have a determination letter from the IRS that they are exempt under section
) and that also qualify as an affiliate of a government unit as described in Rev. Proc.
) The RA must verify a government hospital organization using the employment code or Rev. Proc.
C.B.
ﬁling requirement

) During the review, if the governmental status of the organization is not clear, the RA will contact the group manager who will contact the Government Entities (GE) analyst in the Government Entities Compliance Unit (GECU) determine whether the organization is a government entity. (
) The manager will notify the RA of GE’s decision. The RA must then update case, notating the decision in the conclusion. Agent in (RAIC) Review (

(Hospital - Review Completed). (

(Review Evaluation). (
) The RAIC will review the activity record to verify that all required ﬁelds are complete and accurate. (
) The RAIC will also review the surveys to verify they are complete and accurate based on the case ﬁle documentation.

) On the Closing tab, the manager will verify that the RA/RAIC entered his/her time. Closing (
) All ACA Hospital Review cases are transferred to the ACA Case Assignment Group for ﬁnal closing. (
) The Case Assignment Group employee will complete the ﬁnal close by verifying that all required ﬁelds within RCCMS are complete and then select Status Code
, Final Close . (
